4. **Polling Methodology**: 538's polling average accounts for various polls and applies a model to adjust for biases and sample sizes. This methodology tends to smooth out short-term fluctuations, making sudden swings less likely.

Given these considerations, while it is possible for Trump's lead to increase into the specified range, the short time frame and the current polling position suggest it is not highly probable.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Trump's lead over Biden being between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, several factors need to be considered. Historically, polling averages can fluctuate significantly due to various events, campaign strategies, and public sentiment shifts. As of October 2023, polling data and trends suggest a highly polarized political environment, with both candidates having strong bases of support. The specified range of a 2 to 4-point lead is relatively narrow, making the probability of this specific outcome lower than a broader range. Polling averages are influenced by numerous factors, including economic conditions, major news events, and candidate performance in debates or public appearances. Additionally, polling errors and the inherent uncertainty in predicting public opinion months in advance must be considered. Given these considerations, while it is possible for Trump to have a lead within this range, the combination of the narrow range and the potential for significant fluctuations in polling data suggests a moderate probability of this specific outcome occurring.

metadata.background_info: Usain Bolt's 9.63s Olympic record has stood since the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The current Olympic record for the men's 100m dash is 9.63 seconds, set by Usain Bolt at the London 2012 Olympics. Since then, no athlete has broken this record at the Olympics. The world record, also held by Usain Bolt, is 9.58 seconds, set at the World Championships in 2009. The likelihood of breaking the Olympic record depends on several factors: the current form and fitness of top sprinters, advancements in training techniques, and environmental conditions during the race. As of 2023, no athlete has consistently approached Bolt's record times, and while there are promising sprinters, breaking the Olympic record requires an exceptional performance. Considering these factors, while it's possible for the record to be broken, it remains a challenging feat. Therefore, the probability of the winning time being less than 9.63 seconds is not very high.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
Reasoning: The concept of "Individual Neutral Athletes" (INA) typically refers to athletes who compete under a neutral flag, often due to sanctions or other political reasons affecting their home countries. A recent example is the participation of Russian athletes as neutral competitors due to doping scandals. The likelihood of INA winning 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics depends on several factors:

1. Historical Performance: Historically, Russian athletes have been strong contenders in various sports, including gymnastics, athletics, and swimming. If Russian athletes compete as INAs, they could significantly contribute to the gold medal tally.

2. Number of INAs: The total number of athletes competing as INAs will influence the probability. If a large contingent of high-caliber athletes is competing, the chances increase.

3. Competition Level: The competition level in various sports and the presence of dominant athletes from other countries can affect the likelihood of INA winning gold medals.

4. IOC Decisions: The final decision by the IOC regarding which athletes can compete as INAs will be crucial. If only a limited number of athletes are allowed, the probability decreases.

5. Recent Trends: In recent Olympics where INAs participated, they have not collectively won a large number of gold medals. For example, at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, the Russian Olympic Committee (ROC) won 20 gold medals, but not all were from athletes competing as neutrals.

Given these considerations, while it is possible for INAs to win 15 or more gold medals, it would require a strong showing from a limited number of athletes. The probability is not negligible but remains relatively low due to the competitive nature of the Olympics and the uncertainty around the number of INAs participating.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

metadata.background_info:
The [Bombay Stock Exchange Sensitive Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSE_SENSEX), also known as the S&P BSE SENSEX or simply the SENSEX, is a stock market index consisting of 30 of the largest companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. It is one of the oldest and most widely followed equity indices in India. The SENSEX is intended to reflect the overall performance of the Indian stock market.

India's recent general elections saw incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), win a [narrower victory](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/india-election-modi-bjp-lost-majority-election-surprise-rcna155557) than expected, raising concerns about potential policy paralysis and the ability of the government to implement key economic reforms. As a result, in the immediate aftermath of the elections, the SENSEX has experienced significant volatility, beginning with a [drop of almost 6%](https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2024/6/5/india-election-why-modis-narrow-win-has-the-stock-market-in-a-spin) on June 4th, followed by a significant bounce on June 5th.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate whether the BSE SENSEX will close between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024, we need to consider several factors:

1. **Current Level and Historical Trends**: As of my last update, the BSE SENSEX was around 66,000. Assuming a consistent growth trend, it's important to analyze the historical growth rate. The SENSEX has seen periods of rapid growth, but a jump to 75,000 would require a significant increase.

2. **Economic Indicators**: Economic indicators such as GDP growth, inflation rates, and monetary policy will have a significant impact. If the Indian economy is performing well, this could drive the SENSEX up. Conversely, economic slowdowns or global market downturns could hinder its growth.

3. **Market Sentiment and Global Factors**: Global economic conditions, geopolitical tensions, and investor sentiment can greatly influence market performance. A stable or bullish global market could support a rise in the SENSEX, while instability could suppress growth.

4. **Specific Date Consideration**: July 21, 2024, is a Sunday, and stock markets are typically closed on weekends. This means the closing value would be taken from the previous trading day, July 19, 2024. This could affect the typical trading patterns and market dynamics leading up to that date.

5. **Probability of Narrow Range**: The range of 75,000 to 76,000 is quite narrow, making it statistically less likely for the index to close within this specific range on any given day, even if the general trend is upward.

Given these considerations, while it's possible for the SENSEX to reach this range, the probability of it closing within this narrow band on the specified date is relatively low due to the specificity of the range and the inherent volatility of stock markets.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of a geomagnetic storm with a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 occurring between July 17 and July 28, 2024, we need to consider several factors. The K-index is a measure of geomagnetic activity, and values greater than 5 indicate a geomagnetic storm. The occurrence of such storms is influenced by solar activity, which follows an approximately 11-year cycle. As of 2024, we are likely in a period of heightened solar activity, as the solar cycle 25 is expected to peak around 2024-2025. During periods of high solar activity, the frequency of geomagnetic storms increases.

Historical data shows that K-index values between 5 and 6 are relatively common during periods of high solar activity. However, predicting specific geomagnetic activity within a short time frame is challenging due to the variability of solar events like coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and solar flares. These events can lead to geomagnetic storms if they are directed towards Earth.

Given the expected peak in solar activity and the historical frequency of Kp values in the specified range during such periods, there is a reasonable likelihood of a geomagnetic storm with a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 occurring during the specified timeframe. However, the exact timing and occurrence of such events are inherently uncertain.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The K-index, or Kp index, is a measure of geomagnetic activity. A Kp index of 4 is considered "active," while a Kp index of 5 is classified as a "minor storm." The occurrence of geomagnetic storms with a Kp index between 4 and 5 during a given period depends on solar activity, particularly solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs) from the Sun. During the rising phase of the solar cycle, the frequency of geomagnetic storms typically increases. Given the timing within the solar cycle and the length of the period in question (11 days), it is reasonably likely that at least one geomagnetic storm with a Kp index greater than 4 but less than or equal to 5 could occur. However, predicting the exact Kp index range for a specific period is inherently uncertain due to the variability of solar activity and the specific conditions needed to produce storms of this magnitude.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

metadata.background_info: A few Olympic sports - swimming, athletics, gymnastics - have athletes competing in multiple events. Will the athlete winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Games in Paris be someone competing in the swimming events?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability that a swimmer will win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors. Historically, swimming has been a sport where athletes can win multiple medals due to the variety of events. For instance, Michael Phelps won 8 gold medals in a single Olympics (2008), and swimmers often dominate the list of athletes with the most medals in a single Olympic Games. In recent Olympics, swimmers such as Katie Ledecky, Caeleb Dressel, and Sarah Sjöström have been highly successful, often winning multiple gold medals. The structure of swimming events allows for this possibility, as there are numerous individual and relay events. Additionally, the competition in swimming is intense, and some athletes specialize in multiple strokes and distances, increasing their chances of winning several events. Compared to other sports, like athletics or gymnastics, where the maximum number of events an athlete can compete in is often lower, swimming provides more opportunities for medal accumulation. Considering these factors, and assuming no major changes in the format of the Olympics or unexpected circumstances affecting top swimmers, it is reasonable to estimate a high probability that a swimmer will be the athlete with the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record has risen to 6.24m, set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024.

With Braz suspended from the current Games, will his record be broken Duplantis or another competitor?

metadata.chain_of_thought: Reasoning: The current Olympic record for the men's pole vault is 6.03m, set by Thiago Braz at the 2016 Rio Olympics. Since then, the sport has seen some progression, with athletes like Armand Duplantis consistently clearing heights above 6.00m. Duplantis, in particular, has been a dominant force in pole vaulting, setting the world record at 6.18m in 2020 and continuing to perform at a high level. Given his track record and the proximity of his personal best to the Olympic record, there is a reasonable chance he could break the Olympic record at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Additionally, the Olympics often bring out peak performances due to the high stakes and intense competition. However, breaking records is still a challenging feat, dependent on various factors like weather conditions, athlete form on the day, and equipment. Considering these elements, while the probability is not overwhelmingly high, it is certainly plausible.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The agreement between the US Department of Commerce and Verisign regarding the management of the .com TLD has been longstanding and is deeply integrated into the infrastructure of the internet. Historically, changes to such agreements are often preceded by lengthy discussions, regulatory reviews, and public consultations. As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there were no significant indications or announcements suggesting an imminent termination of this agreement. The DOC and Verisign have typically renewed their agreements with modifications rather than terminating them outright. Additionally, the process of transitioning such a critical piece of internet infrastructure would likely require substantial planning and coordination, which would be difficult to accomplish in the short time frame before August 3, 2024, if no such process has been publicly initiated by mid-2024. Therefore, the probability of the US government ending its agreement with Verisign before the specified date seems low.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess whether the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" will surpass $185,548,391, we need to consider several factors: 

1. **Franchise Popularity**: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters within the Marvel universe. The combination of these two characters could generate significant interest and anticipation, potentially leading to a strong box office performance.

2. **Previous Performance**: "Deadpool" (2016) had an exceptionally strong opening, grossing $132,434,639 domestically. "The Wolverine" (2013), while not as strong, contributed $53,113,752. The total of these two openings is $185,548,391. Given the popularity of both characters, a combined film could potentially draw in fans of both individual franchises.

3. **Market Conditions**: The current market conditions for movies, including factors like the post-pandemic recovery of cinema attendance, competition from streaming services, and the general economic climate, could influence box office results. If the market is favorable, the chances of a strong opening increase.

4. **Marketing and Hype**: The marketing strategy and the level of hype generated by trailers, promotions, and social media can significantly impact the box office opening. If the marketing effectively capitalizes on the fan base of both characters and creates a buzz, it could lead to a higher turnout.

5. **Critical Reception**: Early reviews and critical reception can either boost or dampen box office performance. A positive reception could lead to increased audience interest.

Considering these factors, especially the potential appeal of combining two popular characters and the historical performance of similar films, there is a reasonable likelihood that "Deadpool & Wolverine" could surpass the combined opening of its predecessors.

question.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
question.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability of Poland winning the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship (WTC), several factors need to be considered. Historically, Poland has been a strong competitor in the Warhammer 40,000 community. They have a reputation for having skilled players and have performed well in past team championships. However, the outcome of such tournaments can be highly variable due to the strategic depth of the game, the format of the tournament, and the performance of other strong teams from countries like the USA, UK, Germany, and others.

Additionally, the specific dynamics of the 2024 tournament, such as changes in team compositions, any new rules or meta shifts that could affect gameplay, and the results of recent tournaments leading up to the WTC, should be considered. Without precise data on the current form and preparation of the Polish team compared to their competitors, it is challenging to make a highly accurate prediction.

Given Poland's historical performance and reputation, they likely have a competitive chance, but the probability should be moderated by the inherent uncertainty and competitiveness of the event.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The [100m dash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/100_metres) is one of the highlights of track and field events, with the world champion often referred to as "the world's fastest man".

The [current Olympic record](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_100_metres_world_record_progression) was set by Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt's at the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The current Olympic record for the men's 100m dash is 9.63 seconds, set by Usain Bolt at the 2012 London Olympics. Since then, no athlete has run faster than this time in an Olympic event. However, the world record, also held by Usain Bolt, is 9.58 seconds, set in 2009. Breaking the Olympic record would require an athlete to run faster than 9.63 seconds, which is extremely challenging given the historical context and the rarity of such performances. Recent performances in major competitions like the World Championships and Diamond League events suggest that while there are a few athletes who have the potential to run times close to the Olympic record, consistently achieving sub-9.63 second times is rare. Factors such as weather conditions, track quality, and athlete form on the day of the event will also play significant roles. Considering these factors, while it is within the realm of possibility for the record to be broken, it remains unlikely due to the exceptional nature of the performance required.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors. Historically, the Olympics is an event where new countries occasionally win their first gold medals, but the number tends to be limited. For instance, in recent Olympics, the number of new countries winning their first gold has varied, but it rarely reaches as high as 5. The 2020 Tokyo Olympics saw 3 countries winning their first gold medals: Bermuda, the Philippines, and Qatar. Several factors could influence the outcome in 2024. These include the expansion of sports disciplines, the inclusion of new sports, and the overall increase in the number of participating countries. With the Paris Olympics, there is an opportunity for new sports to be included, which may provide new countries with a better chance to win gold. However, the probability remains low that as many as 5 countries will achieve this milestone, given historical trends and the competitive nature of the Olympics. Additionally, while new sports can provide opportunities, established countries often still dominate due to their resources, experience, and infrastructure. The likelihood of 5 new countries breaking through this dominance is relatively low.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

metadata.background_info:
On July 28, Venezuela held Presidential elections, but full results have not yet been published by the [National Electoral Council (CNE)](https://www.cne.gob.ve/) as of August 2. Hours after polling stations closed, the head of the CNE proclaimed the incumbent, Nicolás Maduro, the winner for a third term.

The opposition and the international community have pointed out irregularities. The CNE [asserted](https://mincyt.gob.ve/nicolas-maduro-gana-las-elecciones-presidenciales/), with 20% of ballots left to count, that Maduro's 7-point lead over the united opposition candidate Edmundo González was "irreversible", which is contradictory – by the CNE's own assertion, there were enough votes left to be counted that González could still take the lead.

Furthermore, the data published by the CNE reports no more than three numbers: the votes for Maduro (51.2% of the total), the ones for González (44.2%), and an aggregated figure for "others" (4.6%). [Analyses of the data](https://elpais.com/america/2024-08-02/quien-gano-en-venezuela-los-datos-de-la-oposicion-son-mas-verificables-que-los-oficiales.html) show that the numbers correspond *exactly* to those percentages, a result consistent with the percentages being made up and the corresponding vote counts being calculated back from them.

Meanwhile, civil society in the country has been performing an [independent, bottom-up verification of the results](https://resultadosconvzla.com/); reports generated immediately after the election by the voting machines in precincts around the country are digitized and posted online. Aggregation of these vote counts show a 37-point victory for González over Maduro.

How will the Chavista president respond? Will he publish a full, disaggregated count of the results?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The Venezuelan electoral commission, known as the Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE), has a history of publishing election results within a reasonable timeframe following elections. However, the political situation in Venezuela is complex and has been marked by controversy and claims of election irregularities in the past. The ability of the CNE to publish full results depends on both logistical and political factors. Logistically, the CNE has the infrastructure to process and release election results efficiently, as seen in previous elections. Politically, the government might have incentives to delay results if the outcome is contested or unfavorable to the ruling party. However, given the specific requirement of publishing results disaggregated to the level of parish, this adds a layer of complexity. Historically, the CNE has managed to release detailed results, although sometimes with delays. Considering these factors, while there is a reasonable expectation that results could be published by the deadline, the political climate might introduce delays. Therefore, the probability of the CNE publishing the full results by August 12, 2024, is moderate.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To determine the likelihood of the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024, we need to consider several economic factors and trends. The Core CPI, which excludes food and energy prices, is a key indicator of underlying inflation trends. Historically, the Core CPI has shown variability based on economic conditions, monetary policy, and external factors such as supply chain disruptions or changes in consumer demand.

1. **Recent Trends**: Historically, monthly changes in Core CPI have often exceeded 0.1%, especially in periods of economic recovery or expansion. Given the data up to October 2023, if the economy is growing and inflationary pressures are present, it is plausible that Core CPI could increase by more than 0.1%.

2. **Monetary Policy**: The Federal Reserve's actions, such as interest rate adjustments, can influence inflation. If the Fed has been implementing policies to curb inflation, this might dampen the increase. Conversely, if they are stimulating the economy, this could lead to higher inflation.

3. **Economic Indicators**: Other economic indicators such as employment rates, wage growth, and consumer spending can provide insights into inflationary pressures. If these indicators suggest robust economic activity, it is more likely that Core CPI will see a significant increase.

4. **External Factors**: Geopolitical events, changes in trade policies, or disruptions in supply chains can also impact prices and inflation.

Given these factors, while there is always uncertainty, the likelihood of a more than 0.1% increase in Core CPI in a single month is relatively high based on historical patterns and potential economic conditions.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The probability of your cat returning home after being let outside depends on several factors, including the cat's previous behavior, its familiarity with the new environment, and its attachment to its new home. Since the cat has been kept indoors for two weeks, it has had some time to adjust to the new home environment, which may increase the likelihood of it returning. Cats are generally territorial and have a good sense of direction, which helps them navigate back to familiar places. However, since this is a new location, the cat's ability to return might be slightly reduced compared to its previous home. Additionally, the cat's personality and past outdoor experiences are important; if the cat is adventurous and has a history of roaming far, it might take longer to return. On the other hand, if the cat is more cautious or has shown a tendency to stay close to home, it is more likely to return within the twelve-hour window. Given these considerations, while there is some uncertainty, the cat's natural instincts and the time it has spent acclimating indoors suggest a reasonable probability of it returning home.

question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The United States has a strong history in Olympic basketball, often being considered the favorite in both the men's and women's tournaments. Historically, the men's team has won 16 out of 19 Olympic gold medals since basketball was introduced to the Olympics in 1936. The women's team has been similarly dominant, winning 9 out of 11 tournaments since women's basketball became an Olympic sport in 1976. For the Paris 2024 Olympics, both teams are expected to field strong rosters with NBA and WNBA stars, which significantly boosts their chances. However, there are always challenges, such as potential injuries, team chemistry issues, and strong competition from other countries like Spain, France, and Australia for the men, and Australia, Spain, and France for the women. Despite these challenges, the depth of talent and experience on the U.S. teams usually gives them a significant edge. The U.S. women's team, in particular, has been extremely dominant in recent years. The men's team, while occasionally upset in international play, has consistently performed well when it matters most. Given these factors, the probability of both teams winning gold is high, but not certain due to the inherent unpredictability of sports and the single-elimination format of the Olympic tournament.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

There is no historical precedent in recent times for an incumbent president dropping out of a race this close to the election without a major catalyst.

4. **Current Campaign Activity**: Biden has been actively campaigning and fundraising, which indicates a strong commitment to running for a second term.

5. **External Factors**: No major external factors (such as a scandal or a major personal issue) have emerged that would force Biden to drop out of the race.

content.text: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: As of the created date of this question, July 8, 2024, there are only five days remaining until the resolution date of July 13, 2024. Joe Biden, the incumbent President of the United States, has announced his intention to run for re-election in the 2024 presidential race. Historically, sitting presidents who are running for re-election do not drop out of the race unless there are extraordinary circumstances, such as severe health issues or significant political scandals. As of the latest data available up to October 2023, there have been no credible reports or indications of any health issues or scandals that would compel President Biden to drop out of the race. Additionally, political campaigns are typically well-prepared for the final months leading up to an election, and it would be highly unusual for a candidate, especially an incumbent president, to withdraw at such a late stage without a major reason. Given the lack of any known factors that would lead to Biden dropping out, and considering the very short time frame until the resolution date, the probability of him dropping out before July 13, 2024, is very low.

question.title: Will there be a red card in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024?
question.body:
Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

Historically, red cards are not extremely common in major tournament semi-finals, but they do occur. The intensity of the match, the skill level of the players, and the style of officiating can all contribute to the probability of a red card being issued. In high-stakes matches, players may be more prone to committing fouls due to pressure, and referees might be stricter to maintain control of the game. Additionally, there are two semi-final matches, which increases the chances of at least one red card being shown compared to a single match. On the other hand, players and teams are typically aware of the stakes and may exercise caution to avoid disciplinary actions that could affect their chances of reaching the final. Considering these factors, the probability of a red card being shown in either semi-final is moderate.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: The 25th Amendment, Section 4, is a mechanism that allows the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to declare the President unable to discharge the powers and duties of the office. This is a significant and rare action that has never been invoked in U.S. history. It is typically reserved for situations where the President is incapacitated due to health reasons or other extreme circumstances. As of the last update in October 2023, there have been no credible reports or indications that President Biden is incapacitated to the extent that would necessitate invoking this section of the 25th Amendment. The context provided mentions a GOP lawmaker asking for this invocation, but such requests are not uncommon in partisan politics and do not usually lead to actual invocation unless there is a broad consensus among the Vice President and Cabinet members. Given the lack of historical precedent, the absence of credible reports on Biden's incapacity, and the political implications of such an action, the likelihood of Section 4 being invoked before August 2024 is very low.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question revolves around whether a coordinated effort by at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators will publicly pressure President Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. The context provided indicates some discontent among Democrats regarding Biden's re-election prospects, with some members already publicly expressing doubts. The existence of drafts of letters and discussions behind the scenes suggests there is some momentum towards such an action. However, there are several factors to consider: 1. Political Dynamics: Publicly urging a sitting president from one's own party to drop out is a significant political move that could have repercussions for the individuals involved. This suggests that while there might be private discontent, translating that into a public and coordinated effort is a higher bar to clear. 2. Historical Precedents: Historically, it is rare for a sitting president to face such public pressure from within their own party to step down. This makes the scenario less likely unless there is a significant shift in political circumstances. 3. Timing and Coordination: The deadline is relatively close, and while there is some indication of behind-the-scenes efforts, the requirement for a coordinated and public action by a group of at least five named members adds complexity. Such actions require careful coordination and agreement, which can be difficult to achieve in a short timeframe. 4. Ambiguity and Resolution Criteria: The question specifies that the names and coordination must be clear and unambiguous. This means that even if there are reports of discontent or pressure, unless it meets the specific criteria, the market will resolve NO. Considering these factors, while there is some evidence of discontent and potential efforts to pressure Biden, the likelihood of a coordinated public action meeting the criteria within the specified timeframe is relatively low.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

content.text: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.
Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does
not
cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability that President Biden will remain in office through the end of July 2024, we need to consider several factors, including his health, political stability, and historical precedent. 1. **Health and Age**: President Biden, born in 1942, is one of the oldest sitting presidents. While age can be a factor in health-related concerns, there have been no public indications of severe health issues that would necessitate resignation or prevent him from fulfilling his duties. Regular medical check-ups and reports have shown him to be in good health for his age. 2. **Political Stability**: As of my knowledge cutoff in October 2023, there were no significant political scandals or pressures that would likely lead to his resignation or removal from office. The political landscape can be volatile, but the mechanisms for removing a sitting president (impeachment and conviction) are complex and require substantial bipartisan support, which is unlikely given the current political climate. 3. **Historical Precedent**: Historically, U.S. presidents typically serve their full terms unless faced with extraordinary circumstances such as severe health issues or overwhelming political pressure. Since the assassination of President Kennedy in 1963, all U.S. presidents have completed their terms unless they chose not to seek re-election or were term-limited. 4. **Temporary Transfer of Power**: The question specifies that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not affect the resolution. This means that even if President Biden were to temporarily transfer power to the Vice President, it would not result in a NO resolution unless he permanently ceased to be president. Considering these factors, while there are always uncertainties, the likelihood of President Biden remaining in office through the end of July 2024 is high.

To estimate the probability of earning a medal at the International Geography Championship, we need to consider several factors:

1. **Past Performance**: The individual has performed well in the Chinese national championship, winning several medals. This indicates a high level of competence and suggests that they have a strong foundation in geography.

2. **Competition Level**: The International Geography Championship is likely to have a higher level of competition compared to national championships. Competitors from various countries, each with their own top performers, will be participating. This increases the difficulty of earning a medal.

3. **Preparation and Skill**: Assuming the individual has continued their preparation and has a strong grasp of geographical knowledge, they may have a competitive edge. Their success in the national championship suggests they are well-prepared.

4. **Number of Medals**: The likelihood of winning a medal also depends on the number of medals available relative to the number of competitors. If the championship awards multiple medals (gold, silver, bronze) across different categories or age groups, this increases the probability of winning a medal.

5. **Uncertainty and Variability**: There is always some level of uncertainty in competitions. Factors such as the individual's performance on the day, the difficulty of the questions, and the performance of other competitors can all influence the outcome.

Considering these factors, while the competition is likely to be tough, the individual's strong past performance and preparation suggest a reasonable chance of earning a medal.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

content.text: Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To assess the probability of the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee being a woman, we need to consider several factors including the current political landscape, the candidates who have declared their intention to run, and historical trends.

1. **Declared Candidates**: As of my last update, Joe Biden, the incumbent President, has announced his intention to run for a second term. Given his current position and the support within the Democratic Party, he is a strong contender. However, if any prominent female candidates have declared their candidacy or are likely to declare, this could influence the probability.

2. **Prominent Female Politicians**: There are several prominent female figures within the Democratic Party who could potentially run or be considered for the nomination, such as Kamala Harris, Elizabeth Warren, or other rising stars. However, none have shown definitive moves to challenge Biden as of the latest updates.

3. **Historical Context**: Historically, the Democratic Party has been more open to nominating diverse candidates, with Hillary Clinton being the first female nominee in 2016. However, the presence of an incumbent President running for re-election typically decreases the likelihood of a contested primary.

4. **Current Political Climate**: The political climate and issues leading up to the 2024 election will play a significant role. If there is a significant shift in public opinion or a major event that changes the dynamics, this could impact the likelihood of a female nominee.

Considering these factors, while there is a possibility of a female nominee, the presence of Joe Biden as the incumbent and his intention to run for re-election makes it less likely for a woman to secure the nomination in 2024 unless unforeseen changes occur.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will this d20 roll be even?
question.body: I will roll the dice sometime the day the question closes and resolve right when i roll it(in order to be fair i will not invest in this market). resolves yes if even and resolves no if odd.

content.text: I will roll the dice sometime the day the question closes and resolve right when i roll it(in order to be fair i will not invest in this market). resolves yes if even and resolves no if odd.

metadata.chain_of_thought: A standard 20-sided die (d20) has 20 faces, numbered from 1 to 20. Out of these, exactly half are even numbers: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, and 20. Therefore, there are 10 even outcomes and 10 odd outcomes. Since the die is fair and each outcome is equally likely, the probability of rolling an even number is simply the ratio of even outcomes to the total number of outcomes. Thus, the probability of rolling an even number is 10/20, which simplifies to 1/2.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

content.text: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of another Democratic party presidential debate occurring before the 2024 Democratic National Convention depends on several factors. Firstly, President Joe Biden, as the incumbent, is seeking re-election, and traditionally, incumbent presidents seeking re-election face limited or no primary debates. This is because the party typically rallies behind the sitting president to present a united front. Additionally, there has been no significant indication from the Democratic National Committee (DNC) or major Democratic figures suggesting that there will be a debate. As of the created date in July 2024, there is little time left before the convention, which further reduces the likelihood of organizing and holding a debate. Moreover, the potential challengers mentioned (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer) have not actively positioned themselves as primary challengers to Biden in a manner that would necessitate a debate. Without strong intra-party competition or significant pressure from within the party, the probability of a debate is low. Given these considerations, it seems unlikely that there will be another Democratic party presidential debate before the convention.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will Uruguay rotate four or more starters (from the Panama match) in their Copa America match against the US?
question.body: Resolves YES if four or more players who started against Panama do not start against the US.

content.text: Resolves YES if four or more players who started against Panama do not start against the US.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability of Uruguay rotating four or more starters from their match against Panama for their Copa America match against the US, we need to consider several factors:

1. **Team Strategy and Context**: Uruguay's decision to rotate players could depend on their strategy for the tournament. If the match against the US is crucial for advancement or positioning, they might field their strongest lineup, potentially reducing the number of rotations. Conversely, if they have already secured a favorable position, they might rest key players.

2. **Player Fitness and Injuries**: Injuries or fitness concerns could necessitate changes in the starting lineup. If there are known injuries or players returning from injury who need rest, this could increase the likelihood of rotations.

3. **Previous Rotation Patterns**: Examining Uruguay's past behavior in similar tournaments can provide insight. If the coach has a history of rotating players frequently, especially between matches with varying levels of importance, this could suggest a higher probability of rotation.

4. **Squad Depth and Talent**: The availability of equally talented substitutes can also influence rotation decisions. A deep squad allows for more flexibility in resting starters without significantly impacting team performance.

5. **Time Between Matches**: The time interval between the match against Panama and the match against the US can affect rotation decisions. A short turnaround might necessitate more changes to maintain player fitness.

Considering these factors and assuming Uruguay is a competitive team with a reasonable depth of talent, it is plausible that they might rotate several players to keep the squad fresh, especially if the match against the US is not critical for their progression in the tournament.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

However, Disney's focus in recent years has been on new intellectual properties and experiences, which might not align with a direct revival of an older attraction unless it can be tied to a current franchise or theme that fits into their strategic vision for Tomorrowland. Additionally, the requirements for the resolution are quite specific, which could limit the possibility of a new Peoplemover-like ride being announced. Given these factors, while there is a possibility for such an announcement, it seems more likely that Disney might focus on other projects that align more closely with their current strategic goals.
